bibl.title: [1822 Nov. 8, Petition to run a ferry on the Chatahoochy River]
bibl.note: This document is a petition, dated November 8, 1822, to the Cherokee Nation to allow William and Daniel May a permit to open a new road for ferry access on the Chattahoochee River. Also included is a decision by the Cherokee Council to request a law suit against Richard Winn for taking forcible possession of the ferry bank previously used by the Mays.

div.p:
The National Committee and Council have determined that a resol communication be made by the Chiefs of Council soliciting to
Col Colonel . Meigs to the Cherokee agent soliciting institute a suit against Richard Wynn for damages in taking forcible possession of the ferry Bank on the Cherokee side, at Vann's ferry on the Chatahoochee Chattahoochee river New Town Nov. 8th 1822
div.closer:
By order of the Committee
John Ross
The petition of Wm William & Daniel May humbly sheweth show that your petitioners having rented of the Cherokee Nation the ferry & improvement at Chatahoochy known by the name of Vanns Ferry, Richard Winn of the state of Georgia having taken forcible possession of the landing on this side of the river to the great injury of your petitioners. your petitioners beg leave of your honorable body to grant them a permit to open a road from the two mile Creek on the road to a ferry above the old Ferry, which would be the nearest and best way for a road. your Compliance will much oblige your friends & which favor will ever be acknowledge & respected
Wm William May
